website_summaries.verdict: While it's a bit pricey for what it does, the Sonos WD100 Wireless Dock is a flexible accessory that allows you to stream your music collection directly from your iPhone or iPod without turning on a computer.
pros: Easy way to stream music from an iPhone or iPod to your multiroom Sonos system
cons: locks down iPod or iPhone, temporarily obviating one of the Sonos system's biggest advantages

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: As others have written already, this piece of kit is WELL worth it. Works flawlessly and as a bonus it acts as a docking and charging station for your iPhone/iPod that u can have situated anywhere in your home/office. The awesome thing about Sonos' products is the similarity with Apple's software, interface, and hardware design and look/feel, which as we all know, is no bad thing... These guys make superb, highly-refined and well-thought out products. This one is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: Nizar Dahbar

customer_reviews.title: SONOS.... it actually says it all
customer_reviews.text: If you use an iPod (any model), than this is a 'slip it into the cradle... and it plays where you left off' item. As with all of the Sonos items, it is a no-brainer to use or set up. Expensive, but as with Sonos.... it reflects the motto, 'you get what you pay for.'
customer_reviews.author: U2strategy

customer_reviews.title: Love Sonos
customer_reviews.text: Sonos is pricey, but you can't beat it for a wireless sound system that just works. Easy to set up, easy to use. Had a problem connecting to my computer once, and their tech support took care of it. It's taken me a couple years, but I now have Sonos speakers all over my house and I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel E. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Simple to set up with sonos 5 and and bridge. Installed software on my PC and downloaded controller app for my Galaxy S3. The whole took 30 minutes and I was playing the Ipod or Pandora wirelessly in my living room or the entire music collection on my PC.
customer_reviews.author: R.A. Fogel

customer_reviews.title: This enables a great use of our old monster Ipod
customer_reviews.text: Magic. Sonos has changed the music experience in our house. This enables a great use of our old monster Ipod, lots of music and know is accessible by any device in the house. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: T. J.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Sonos system allows 65K song tags which means even though I only have 56K songs many of my songs are not on my system with the doc for iPod I can get the missing songs on my ststem.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Randy Burnham

customer_reviews.title: Very Convenient
customer_reviews.text: If your goal is to stream audio from an iPod using the old 30-pin dock connector to your Sonos speakers, this is the way to do it. I use it with a 6th-gen iPod Nano. It locks up every once in a while, but all you have to do to fix that is reset the iPod by holding down the sleep/wake button and the volume down button for a few seconds. Put it right by your front door and you'll be able to transition between headphones and Sonos almost seamlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gorman

customer_reviews.title: Another great Sonos Product
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge fan of the Sonos line - and this product makes it only better. Very nice to be able to have Ipod's plugged in throughout the house and be able to listen to them anywhere in the house. A great addition to a great product line.
customer_reviews.author: Turbo

customer_reviews.title: he loved it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my Dad for Christmas, he loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Shelpman

customer_reviews.title: Sonos iPod dock
customer_reviews.text: First a little plug for the S5 speaker (which I did not purchase from Amazon): I am very impressed with the quality of the sound and the speaker's sonic detail. The dock is very easy set up. I've had no problems with the music transmission. It's nice to use when I don't want to turn on my computer and this is probably one of the reasons to purchase the dock. Amazon did a nice job of packaging the dock and it arrived within the time frame they estimated. I am satisfied with buying from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: marc

customer_reviews.title: Seamless, like all Sonos devices
customer_reviews.text: Like everything I own from the Sonos system, this device set up in seconds, and worked immediately. After syncing, drop in an iPhone or iPod, and the music is immediately available from anywhere in the system. It can also be automatically configured to play to a specific area when the used. The system requested an update when the device was first used, which only took about 2 minutes to complete. Sonos may seem expensive, but it is engineered perfectly and I would highly recommend this device and the system as a whole.
customer_reviews.author: Travels For Work

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Sonos dock to play protected iTunes songs on my iPod instead of repurchasing them and it works as advertised. Only issue I experienced was the dock wouldn't play the track I selected, and after turning the shuffle track option on the iPod off I've had no issues. Another nice Sonos product.
customer_reviews.author: Jebster

customer_reviews.title: Sonos wireless dock
customer_reviews.text: Like all of my Sonos products, this device works extremely well, and is simple to use. It can be moved around and never loses contact with the system. Recently, I used it during a party where my guest brought music on their iPod and I controlled it from the free Sonos App on my iPhone. I could run all the playlists on their iPod. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Wireless dock
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could get more of these but has been discontinued by manufacture. Works well and setup is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Nicklin

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: For all Sonos System Lovers this is a must have. It will make your system easier to connect. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: JosephU

customer_reviews.title: works great-especially when guests come over
customer_reviews.text: I love this wireless dock for my sonos system. When the kids come over, they merely dock their iphones and can listen to all their music through my existing sonos system.
customer_reviews.author: Reuben Rosenblatt

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is great product for me I would definitely recommend . Thank you sonos....
customer_reviews.author: YERSAN

customer_reviews.title: The missing link!
customer_reviews.text: This was the missing link in the Sonos eco-system. The problem: People come over and say "can I play my music", and until now, there wasn't any elegant way to connect to Sonos (other than a cable). Now, they plug in, and can play all over... totally love it. Charges too, an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Sonos No Longer Making this Device
customer_reviews.text: Sonos has published that they will no longer make this device. However, support will be available for existing owners for the time being. The reason they provided is because the new iPhone 5 connector will not work on this device.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Constantly loses WiFi connection
customer_reviews.text: I do not have the great experiences others have had with the iPod dock. I have 6 Sonos components and they all work fairly flawlessly. They get music from the internet (Rhapsody) or my Media Vault without issue. This dock, however, constantly drops the WiFi connection. It really cannot get through a single song without losing the signal. Doesn't matter where the device is placed or the iPod used. Not very happy about the iPod dock, but everything else I have from Sonos works well.
customer_reviews.author: R. Baker

customer_reviews.title: IT IS NOT NECESSARY
customer_reviews.text: You do not need this device to listen to music from your iPod, the sonos does it automatically. Probably this was with the old technology. Please check before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Vargas Pablo

product_meta.title: Sonos Wireless Dock 100 for iPod and iPhone (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER


Wirelessly dock, charge
and play music from an
iPod or iPhone on Sonos. The Sonos Wireless Dock (WD100) is the perfect accessory for your Sonos system. It lets you wirelessly play all the music that's stored or playing on an iPod® or iPhone®, including many streaming music apps, in all the rooms where you have Sonos. Wireless music playback on Sonos Simply dock any supported iPod or iPhone and enjoy your tunes all over the house on your Sonos system.  * Wirelessly play what’s stored or playing, including many streaming music apps.
 * Play the same song from a docked iPod or iPhone in every room—perfectly synchronized.
 * Autoplay keeps the music playing—dock your iPod and the music that’s been playing automatically continues on any selected ZonePlayer or group of Zones.

Flexible music control Browse and select the music from either your docked iPod or any Sonos Controller. Quick charging dock Supports Apple's 1Amp charging specification so your iPod or iPhone are ready to go when you are. Best-in-class wireless technology SonosNet 2.0 wireless mesh network functionality
allows you to:  * Dock your iPod or iPhone wherever you want.
 * Wirelessly play back the music on any or all the Sonos ZonePlayers in the house.

High-fidelity digital sound The Sonos Wireless Dock sounds far better than
conventional docks.  * Directly accesses the digital music files on your iPod and sends them wirelessly to ZonePlayers—without ever converting to analog like most conventional docks.
 * Preserves the sound quality from the iPod to the speaker, ensuring you get the highest fidelity sound.

Works with any player, in any room Find the product that's right for you or mix and match to create the ultimate multi-room music system. Sonos Starter Kit
S5 + ZoneBridge Sonos S5 ZonePlayer 120 ZonePlayer 90 Where does it go? ZoneBridge attaches to your router, S5 goes anywhere Anywhere Any room with speakers Any room with existing audio equipment How does it play music? Standalone all-in-one music player Standalone all-in-one music player Attaches to your favorite pair of speakers Connects to your home theater, stereo, powered speakers, etc. What makes it special? Lets you put your S5 (5 integrated speakers & digital amps) in any room, regardless of router location 5 integrated speakers and digital amps Built-in 55W per channel digital amplifier Analog and audio digital outputs How do I connect to the Internet? With the included ZoneBridge With either a ZonePlayer or ZoneBridge (sold separately). Once connected, all additional ZonePlayers and Controllers work wirelessly. If your router isn't in a room where you want music, you can connect to the Internet with a ZoneBridge. What you need At least one Sonos
ZonePlayer
Broadband Internet
Wireless router What's in the box Sonos Wireless Dock (WD100)
Universal Dock Adapter (1 size fits all)
AC Adapter
Warranty and Regulatory booklet
Setup Poster Technical Specifications All digital audio The Sonos Wireless Dock directly accesses the digital music stored on your iPhone or iPod and sends it wirelessly to Sonos ZonePlayers all throughout your home. Autoplay Dock your iPod or iPhone and the music that's been playing automatically starts playing on any Sonos ZonePlayer or group of Zones. iPods and iPhones supported iPod touch (1st, 2nd, and 3rd generation)
iPod classic
iPod nano (3rd, 4th, and 5th generation)
iPhone 4, iPhone 3GS, iPhone 3G, iPhone DC Power Supply Input 100-240 VAC, 50-60 Hz; Output 5 VDC, 2A Dimensions (H x W x D) 1.1x 3.8 x 3.2 in. (28 x 97 x 82 mm) Weight 0.34 lb (155g)
feature_bullets: Wirelessly play the music from a docked iPod or iPhone, including music apps, on Sonos ZonePlayers
Dock and charge wherever it’s most convenient
Control the music from your docked iPod or any Sonos Controller
Requires at least one Sonos ZonePlayer, high-speed Internet connection and wireless router
